Package com.netcracker.tc.tests.anns

Annotations for adding meta-information to test case classes, that is used to configure test scenarios with Configurator.

See:
          Description

Annotation Types Summary
Output Scenario output field.
Outputs Marks class as container for multiple Outputs of Scenario, each output of this result can be referenced independently.
Param Scenario parameter.
Params Marks Scenario parameter, as class, containing other Param.
Scenario Scenario method annotation, contains parameters, (marked as Param if needed), Scenario must be non-static method of Scenarios annotated class.
Scenarios Scenarios, merks class, that contains Scenarios as public non-static methods, marked as Scenario
 

Package com.netcracker.tc.tests.anns Description

Annotations for adding meta-information to test case classes, that is used to configure test scenarios with Configurator.

Adding information about test scenarios using annotations

Test scenarios

Test scenarios are described as methods, annotated with Scenario, in class, annotated with Scenarios: 

  @Scenatios
  public class Person
  {
      @Scenario
      public void create();
 
      @Scenario
      public void remove();
  }

Test scenario input parameters

Scenario input parameters can be described in two ways:
  1. scenario method parameters, annotated with Param and (optional) type-specific annotations. 
     @Scenario
 public void create(@Param("name") String name) { ... }

    For this type of parameters Param#value must be set, other attributes are optional: @Param(value = "name", title = "Name", description = "Person name", defValue = "Jhon Doe")

  2. single scenario method parameter, annotated with Params of class with fields, annotated with Param. 
     public class PersonData
 {
     @Param
     public String name;
 }   
 
 @Scenario
 public void create(@Params PersonData person) { ... }

    For this type of parameter passing Param.value() is optional.

Scenario parameter type is infered from field/parameter java type and type-specific annotations (for example Ref).

Test scenario output results

Scenario output results can be described also in two ways:
  1. single scenario method return value, configured with Scenario.output(). 
     @Scenario(ouput = @Output("Person"))
 public PersonData create() { ... return id; }
  2. scenario method returns object of class, annotated with Outputs, it's fields, annotated with Output, will be independent scenario output. 
     @Outputs
 public class Result
 {
     @Output(type = "person:id")
     public String employee;
     
     @Output(type = "person:id")
     public String manager;
     
     @Output(type = "time")
     public int timeElapsed;
 }
 @Scenario
 public Result create() { ... }

Type of output result can be set as string id (for example "person:id"), or as type name, if type is not set.
